description: From earlier bagpipe, from Middle English bagpipe; equivalent to bag +‎ pipes.

entries.meaning: A musical wind instrument of Celtic origin, possessing a flexible bag inflated by bellows, a double-reed melody pipe and up to four drone pipes; any aerophone that produces sound using air from a reservoir to vibrate enclosed reeds.
examples: Bagpipes are traditionally played in most Celtic regions and many former parts of the British Empire.
